intro: Goeppertia albovaginata, commonly known as the White Vein Calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated foliage with white veins on deep green leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. It is a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements. Goeppertia albovaginata thrives in humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
